page.title: 07HOUSING IN MARTON/NUNTHORPE
page.content: The most numerous type of dwelling, be it house or bungalow, appears to be the semi-detached (60% in the survey) followed by detached (31%). A great variety in both design and size of house exists. The largest houses, set in their own grounds, are to be found along Guisborough Rd., Nunthorpe. Many of the houses in both Marton and Nunthorpe are of 'open plan' frontage reflecting the housing style of the l970's. As far as building materials go brick is certainly the most used material for house walls (99% of the houses in Marton have brick walls), although there are some recently built rough-stone houses at Grey Towers, Nunthorpe. Roofs are predominantly tile (98% in Marton) with some slate on the older houses (2% in Marton). In Nunthorpe, near the library, stands a house with a thatched roof.
